relevant_findings.General: Elderly, thin, frail gentleman, alert and conversant with some trouble speaking in complete sentences.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Anicteric, scant white pallor on posterior pharynx, prominent bilateral lymphadenopathy.
relevant_findings.Cardiac: RRR, III/VI holosystolic murmur best appreciated with left sternal border, softer holosystolic murmur at apex, JVP mildly elevated 4 cm above clavicle at 45 degrees.
relevant_findings.Lung: Diminished breath sounds bilaterally with intermittent wheezing and rhonchi, best appreciated in right lung fields.
relevant_findings.Abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, normal bowel sounds, no hepatomegaly.
relevant_findings.Extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ bilateral pitting edema.
relevant_findings.Neurological: A&Ox3, cranial nerves grossly intact, moving all extremities.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 2+ bilateral lower extremity pitting edema which was new from 2 weeks ago.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had 2+ bilateral lower extremity pitting edema which was noted as new compared to 2 weeks prior, indicating worsening edema.
